content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the vectors <math alttext="vector u"><mover><mi>u</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> are given by <math alttext="vector u equals open angle brackets 5 comma 1 close angle brackets"><mover><mi>u</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="vector v equals open angle brackets 3 comma negative 2 close angle brackets"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>. Which of the following gives the calculation of the dot product of the vectors?

choices.label: The dot product of <math alttext="vector u"><mover><mi>u</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 5 close parentheses open parentheses 3 close parentheses plus open parentheses 1 close parentheses open parentheses negative 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mn>1</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

The dot product of <math alttext="vector u"><mover><mi>u</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 5 close parentheses open parentheses 3 close parentheses minus open parentheses 1 close parentheses open parentheses negative 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced><mn>1</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

The dot product of <math alttext="vector u"><mover><mi>u</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 5 close parentheses open parentheses negative 2 close parentheses plus open parentheses 1 close parentheses open parentheses negative 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mn>1</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

The dot product of <math alttext="vector u"><mover><mi>u</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 5 close parentheses open parentheses negative 2 close parentheses minus open parentheses 1 close parentheses open parentheses negative 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mfenced><mn>1</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

content.answer: The dot product of <math alttext="vector u"><mover><mi>u</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 5 close parentheses open parentheses 3 close parentheses plus open parentheses 1 close parentheses open parentheses negative 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mn>1</mn></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
